mapping_metadata.title: 1941-Q2 North Africa Aircraft → WITW Database Mappings
mapping_metadata.purpose: Links historically-extracted aircraft (Tier 1/Tier 2 sources) to existing WITW IDs from v4 JSONs
mapping_metadata.note: All WITW IDs are from existing project data. Historical extraction validates these entries with primary sources.

Bf_109E.operational_notes: Primary German fighter in North Africa Q2 1941. I./JG 27 based at Gazala airfield.
Bf_109E.historical_accuracy: HIGH - Tessin explicitly identifies Bf 109 equipment for I./JG 27

Bf_109F.extraction_source: Tessin Band 14 - I./JG 27 transitioning to F variant Q2 1941
Bf_109F.operational_notes: Advanced variant arriving Q2 1941, better performance than E-7
Bf_109F.historical_accuracy: MEDIUM - Tessin confirms I./JG 27 had Bf 109, variant transition inferred from deployment dates

Ju_87B.extraction_source: Tessin Band 14 - StG 3 reference (ERROR CORRECTION: NOT in Q2 1941)
Ju_87B.operational_notes: HISTORICAL CORRECTION: StG 3 was in Greece/Balkans during Q2 1941, NOT in North Africa. Only deployed to Africa January 1942.
Ju_87B.historical_accuracy: HIGH - Tessin explicitly shows StG 3 deployment timeline, corrects planning assumptions
Ju_87B.critical_finding: Corrects v4 JSON which included StG 3 in 1941-Q2

Bf_110C.extraction_source: Tessin Band 14 - ZG 26 presence requires additional research
Bf_110C.operational_notes: ZG 26 presence in North Africa Q2 1941 not confirmed in Tessin extraction
Bf_110C.historical_accuracy: LOW - Requires additional primary source research

summary.critical_correction: StG 3 NOT in North Africa Q2 1941

CR_42.extraction_source: TM E 30-420 Section 149 - Operational aircraft types
CR_42.operational_notes: Biplane fighter, obsolescent by 1941 but still in use. TM E 30-420 confirms operational status.
CR_42.historical_accuracy: HIGH - TM E 30-420 explicitly lists CR.42 as operational

MC_200.extraction_source: TM E 30-420 Section 149 + Figure 164 'Used in Libya'
MC_200.operational_notes: Primary Italian fighter 1941. TM E 30-420 Figure 164 explicitly confirms 'Used in Libya'.
MC_200.historical_accuracy: VERY HIGH - Direct confirmation of Libya deployment in primary source

MC_202.extraction_source: TM E 30-420 Section 149 - Entering service mid-1941
MC_202.witw_source: No WITW ID found in v4 mappings
MC_202.operational_notes: Advanced fighter entering service mid-1941, limited numbers in North Africa Q2
MC_202.historical_accuracy: HIGH - TM E 30-420 confirms entering service
MC_202.witw_mapping_status: REQUIRES RESEARCH - Not found in existing v4 mappings

SM_79.extraction_source: TM E 30-420 Section 149 - Most important Italian bomber
SM_79.operational_notes: Three-engine bomber, also used as torpedo bomber. TM E 30-420 identifies as most important Italian bomber.
SM_79.historical_accuracy: VERY HIGH - Explicit primary source confirmation

BR_20.extraction_source: TM E 30-420 Section 149 - Operational medium bomber
BR_20.operational_notes: Twin-engine medium bomber operational in North Africa
BR_20.historical_accuracy: HIGH - TM E 30-420 confirms operational status

Cant_Z1007.extraction_source: TM E 30-420 Section 149 - Operational medium bomber
Cant_Z1007.witw_source: No WITW ID found in v4 mappings
Cant_Z1007.operational_notes: Three-engine medium bomber, TM E 30-420 confirms operational
Cant_Z1007.historical_accuracy: HIGH - TM E 30-420 confirms operational status
Cant_Z1007.witw_mapping_status: REQUIRES RESEARCH - Not found in existing v4 mappings

summary.data_gaps: Specific squadriglie assignments, exact aircraft numbers

Hurricane.extraction_source: RAF Museum 1941 Timeline - Operation Battleaxe (June 1941) 253 Wing + specific squadrons

specifications.variants: Mk I and Mk II operational Q2 1941
specifications.status: primary RAF single-engine fighter North Africa

Hurricane.operational_notes: Primary RAF fighter. 253 Wing had 2 squadrons for Operation Battleaxe. No.33 Squadron returned from Greece operations.
Hurricane.historical_accuracy: HIGH - Multiple squadron confirmations from Tier 2 source (RAF Museum)

Tomahawk.extraction_source: RAF Museum 1941 Timeline - 253 Wing Operation Battleaxe
Tomahawk.operational_notes: American P-40 used by RAF in desert. 253 Wing included 1 squadron for Operation Battleaxe.
Tomahawk.historical_accuracy: HIGH - RAF Museum confirms Operation Battleaxe participation
Tomahawk.witw_mapping_status: WITW ID requires research (marked in v4 mappings)

Kittyhawk.extraction_source: RAF Museum 1941 Timeline - Later P-40 variants

specifications.notes: Later P-40 variant, may have arrived late Q2 1941

Kittyhawk.operational_notes: Later variant of P-40. Uncertain if present in Q2 1941 or later quarters.
Kittyhawk.historical_accuracy: MEDIUM - Requires verification of Q2 1941 presence

Blenheim.operational_notes: Light bomber and reconnaissance. Multiple squadrons active in Middle East theater.
Blenheim.historical_accuracy: VERY HIGH - Multiple squadron confirmations from RAF Museum

Wellington.extraction_source: RAF Museum 1941 Timeline - No.148 Squadron recalled 9 March 1941
squadrons_confirmed: No.148 Squadron RAF (recalled from Malta 9 March 1941)
Wellington.operational_notes: Medium/heavy bomber. No.148 Squadron recalled to Middle East from Malta in March 1941.
Wellington.historical_accuracy: HIGH - RAF Museum timeline confirms squadron movement
Wellington.witw_mapping_status: WITW ID requires research (marked in v4 mappings)

Lysander.witw_source: No WITW ID found in v4 mappings
Lysander.operational_notes: Army cooperation and reconnaissance role. No.208 Squadron active in theater.
Lysander.witw_mapping_status: REQUIRES RESEARCH - Not found in existing v4 mappings

Maryland.extraction_source: RAF Museum 1941 Timeline - SAAF Operation Battleaxe
Maryland.witw_source: No WITW ID found in v4 mappings (but Martin Baltimore II has ID 607)
Maryland.operational_notes: American-built reconnaissance bomber. SAAF operated in desert operations.
Maryland.historical_accuracy: HIGH - RAF Museum confirms SAAF participation
Maryland.witw_mapping_status: REQUIRES RESEARCH - Maryland not found, but Baltimore (later variant) is ID 607

Boston.extraction_source: RAF Museum 1941 Timeline - Operational by November 1941
Boston.operational_notes: Confirmed for Operation Crusader (November 1941). Uncertain if present in Q2 1941.
Boston.historical_accuracy: MEDIUM - Confirmed for Q4 1941, Q2 presence uncertain

Beaufighter.extraction_source: RAF Museum 1941 Timeline - Operational by November 1941
Beaufighter.witw_source: No WITW ID found in v4 mappings
Beaufighter.operational_notes: Confirmed for Operation Crusader (November 1941). Uncertain if present in Q2 1941.
Beaufighter.historical_accuracy: MEDIUM - Confirmed for Q4 1941, Q2 presence uncertain
Beaufighter.witw_mapping_status: REQUIRES RESEARCH - Not found in existing v4 mappings

Spitfire.extraction_source: Not extracted from RAF Museum for Q2 1941
Spitfire.operational_notes: Spitfire VB in v4 mappings but NOT extracted from RAF Museum for Q2 1941. Likely arrived later.
Spitfire.historical_accuracy: LOW for Q2 1941 - No Q2 confirmation in extraction
Spitfire.witw_mapping_status: WITW ID exists but Q2 1941 presence NOT confirmed by historical extraction

summary.data_gaps: Exact aircraft numbers per squadron, April-May details (only June Operation Battleaxe data)

ready_for_integration.german: 2 aircraft types with WITW IDs confirmed
ready_for_integration.italian: 4 aircraft types with WITW IDs confirmed
ready_for_integration.british: 6 aircraft types with WITW IDs confirmed

custom_id_assignments.note: Aircraft not in WITW database should receive custom IDs in 160000-169999 range per project convention

next_steps: Replace v4 JSON aircraft sections with historically-verified data
Add source citations for all aircraft entries
Document confidence levels for each aircraft type
Integrate with existing ground TO&E data
critical_corrections_to_apply: REMOVE StG 3 (Ju 87) from German 1941-Q2 data (historical error corrected)
UPDATE German to show ONLY I./JG 27 (Bf 109) as fighter presence
ADD Italian MC.200 Libya deployment confirmation

german.historical_accuracy: VERY HIGH - Tier 1 primary source with explicit unit identifications

italian.historical_accuracy: HIGH - Tier 1 primary source, aircraft types confirmed, deployments partially inferred

british.historical_accuracy: HIGH for June 1941 - Tier 2 source with specific squadron identifications

key_discoveries: Only I./JG 27 (30-40 Bf 109s) represented German air power in North Africa Q2 1941
StG 3 was NOT in North Africa during Q2 1941 (corrects v4 JSON error)
Italian Regia Aeronautica bore primary Axis air burden with confirmed MC.200, SM.79 operations
British RAF had 10-15 squadrons operational (150-200+ aircraft estimated)
Commonwealth participation documented: SAAF (Hurricane, Maryland), RAAF (253 Wing)
MC.200 'Used in Libya' explicitly confirmed in TM E 30-420 Figure 164
v4_json_corrections_required: Reduce German aircraft count to reflect only I./JG 27
Add squadron-level detail for British RAF forces
Update source citations to reflect Tier 1/Tier 2 extraction methodology
historical_findings_summary.methodology_validation: 3-tier source waterfall successfully applied. Tier 1 worked for German/Italian. British required Tier 2 escalation (RAF Museum) when Tier 1 (TM30-410) insufficient.
